title: Switcher Inner - Comprehensive Usage Examples
description: Child block for tp-switcher parent, represents one of two switchable content panels for toggle comparisons
architectureNote: CRITICAL: This is a CHILD BLOCK that must be inside tpgb/tp-switcher parent. It cannot be inserted independently (inserter: false). The parent switcher controls the toggle button and switching behavior. EXACTLY TWO tp-switch-inner blocks are required (index 0 and index 1) for the switcher to work.

examples.visualDescription: Toggle between 'Monthly' and 'Annual' pricing plans, annual shows 20% savings badge

validationRules.block_id: Required, unique identifier for each switch panel
validationRules.index: Required, must be 0 or 1 (switcher supports exactly 2 panels)
validationRules.className: Optional CSS class for custom styling
validationRules.requiredPair: CRITICAL: Must have both index 0 and index 1 panels for switcher to work
validationRules.innerBlocks: Array of child blocks, supports any tpgb block for rich content
validationRules.parentRequired: Must be inside tpgb/tp-switcher parent block

warnings: CRITICAL: This is a CHILD BLOCK that MUST be inside tpgb/tp-switcher parent - cannot be used independently (inserter: false)
CRITICAL: EXACTLY TWO tp-switch-inner blocks required (index 0 and index 1) - no more, no less
index must be either 0 or 1 - no other values allowed
If index 0 or index 1 is missing, switcher won't work (both panels required)
Parent tp-switcher controls all styling (toggle button colors, borders, typography)
Parent switcher labels (label1, label2) should describe what each panel contains
Switcher is designed for binary comparisons (A vs B, not A vs B vs C)
Content should be comparable or related between the two panels
Panel content is hidden until toggled - use lazy loading for heavy content
Each panel should have roughly similar content height to avoid layout shift
Don't use switcher for unrelated content - use tabs or accordion instead
innerBlocks must contain valid WordPress block objects with blockName and attrs
Each innerBlock needs unique block_id to avoid React rendering issues
Parent switcher's defaultValue (0 or 1) determines which panel shows first
commonMistakes: Trying to insert tp-switch-inner directly without parent tpgb/tp-switcher (won't work - inserter disabled)
Creating only one panel (index 0) without the paired panel (index 1)
Creating more than 2 panels (switcher only supports 2 - use tabs for 3+ options)
Using index values other than 0 or 1 (e.g., index 2, index 3)
Forgetting to set index attribute (defaults to undefined, breaks switching)
Not coordinating panel content with parent switcher labels
Using generic labels in parent ('Option 1', 'Option 2' instead of 'Monthly', 'Annual')
Creating vastly different content heights between panels (causes jarring layout shift)
Not providing block_id for innerBlocks (can cause rendering issues)
Using switcher for 3+ options (use tp-tabs-tours instead)
Putting unrelated content in the two panels (confuses users)
Forgetting that both panels load on page load (don't put heavy content in both)
Not testing mobile view (toggle button may need different styling)
Using switcher when accordion or tabs would be more appropriate
Not matching visual hierarchy between the two panels (one panel has h3, other has h2)
bestPractices: Always create BOTH panels (index 0 and 1) - switcher requires exactly 2
Use descriptive parent labels: 'Monthly' vs 'Annual', not 'Option 1' vs 'Option 2'
Keep content structure similar between panels for visual consistency
Use switcher for binary comparisons: pricing, features, plans, views, before/after
Coordinate panel content height to minimize layout shift when switching
Use tp-pricing-table for pricing comparisons (most common switcher use case)
Use tp-stylist-list with checkmarks/crosses for feature comparisons
Add visual emphasis to preferred option (badges, colors, 'Most Popular' ribbons)
Test toggle animation on mobile (parent controls animation speed)
Use tp-messagebox to highlight key differences or savings
Structure innerBlocks consistently: heading → content → list → CTA
Set parent's defaultValue to show most popular option first (e.g., annual = 1)
Use responsive column layouts inside panels (tp-row + tp-column)
Add CTAs (tp-button) at bottom of each panel when appropriate
Use iconColor strategically: green for included, red for missing, orange for caveats
For pricing: show monthly equivalent on annual plans ($756/year = $63/month)
For features: use same order of items in both panels for easy scanning
Test keyboard accessibility (Tab to focus toggle, Enter/Space to switch)
Use switcher for A/B presentation, not for navigation (use tabs for navigation)
Consider using tp-before-after block for image-based before/after comparisons
Limit innerBlocks to essential content (3-5 blocks per panel ideal)
Use semantic HTML in panel content (proper heading hierarchy)
Test on mobile - ensure toggle button is touch-friendly (minimum 44px height)

parentControls.labels: Parent sets label1 (for index 0 panel) and label2 (for index 1 panel)

parentControls.behavior: Parent controls switching animation, default active panel (defaultValue)
parentControls.layout: Parent controls toggle button position (above/below content)

childControls.content: Child controls what's shown in each panel (innerBlocks)
childControls.index: Child must set index to 0 or 1 to coordinate with parent

accessibilityConsiderations: Switcher is keyboard accessible (Tab to focus toggle, Enter/Space to switch panels)
ARIA attributes automatically added (role='button', aria-pressed, aria-controls)
Parent switcher labels are read by screen readers - make them descriptive
Panel content should have proper heading hierarchy (h3, h4) for screen reader navigation
Ensure sufficient color contrast for toggle button (active vs inactive states)
Test with keyboard: Tab (focus), Enter/Space (toggle), Tab (navigate panel content)
Panel switching should have clear visual feedback (parent controls styling)
Don't rely solely on color to indicate active panel (use underline, bold, etc.)
Use semantic HTML in panel content for screen reader comprehension
Toggle button should have minimum 44px touch target for mobile accessibility
performanceOptimization: Both panels load on page load (content is hidden, not lazy-loaded like tabs)
Keep panel content lightweight for fast initial render
Use image lazy loading inside panels if heavy images present
Parent switcher uses CSS transitions for smooth switching (GPU-accelerated)
Limit innerBlocks to essential content per panel (3-5 blocks ideal)
Test mobile performance - ensure smooth toggle transitions
Total content per panel recommended max: 5-7 blocks to avoid slow switching
Consider using tp-tabs-tours if you have 3+ options (tabs are more performant for many panels)

troubleshooting.issue: Switcher not working / nothing happens when toggled
solutions: Verify BOTH panels exist (index 0 AND index 1)
Check that parent tpgb/tp-switcher exists
Verify index values are exactly 0 and 1 (not missing, not other values)
Check browser console for JavaScript errors
Test in incognito mode to rule out browser extension conflicts
Verify index 0 is for label1 content, index 1 is for label2 content
Check parent's defaultValue (0 = show index 0 first, 1 = show index 1 first)
Verify block_id is unique for each panel
Check that index values haven't been swapped accidentally
Verify you're inside a tpgb/tp-switcher parent block
Check you don't already have 2 panels (switcher only allows 2)
Try adding panel via parent switcher controls instead
Check browser console for JavaScript errors
Ensure both panels have similar content height
Use consistent innerBlock structure in both panels
Set min-height on parent switcher to prevent shifting
Test with actual content (not placeholder text) to see real heights

troubleshooting.issue: Toggle button not visible / styled incorrectly
solutions: Check parent switcher styling settings (toggle button colors)
Verify parent switcher has label1 and label2 set (button needs labels)
Check for CSS conflicts from theme or plugins
Test in incognito mode to rule out caching issues
